<root><template><title>Command</title><part><name>Comments</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma </value></part><part><name>Game name</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00</value></part><part><name>Game version</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Math </value></part><part><name>GROUP1</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Returns [[true]] if the provided number is finite (not infinite and a valid number). 
<template lineStart="1"><title> Informative </title><part><name index="1"/><value> 
* Maximum finite [[Number]] : 3.40282e+38
* Minimum finite [[Number]] : -3.40282e+38 </value></part></template></value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> [[finite]] number </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> number: [[Number]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Boolean]] </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>[[finite]] 123; <template><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>returns true</value></part></template></code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE1</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>[[finite]] [[log]] -1; <template><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>returns false</value></part></template></code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE2</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>x3</name>=<value> <code>[[if]] ([[not]] [[finite]] [[log]] -1) [[then]] { [[hint]] "Infinite" };</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE3</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value>  </value></part><part><name>SEEALSO</name>=<value>
</value></part></template>

<h3 style="display:none">Notes</h3>
<dl class="command_description">
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment>
<dd class="notedate">Posted on 27 Sep, 2013
<dt class="note">[[User:Killzone_Kid|Killzone_Kid]]
<dd class="note">
Don't get high hopes with this command thinking what a great way of catching divisions by zero, the command is pretty useless in this respect:
<code><template><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value><template><title>arma2</title></template></value></part></template>
[[hint]] [[str]] [[finite]] (10/0);	<template><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>true ... O_o Huh????</value></part></template>
[[hint]] [[str]] (10/0);		<template><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>0 ... Weird, but that explains it.</value></part></template>

<template lineStart="1"><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value><template><title>arma3</title></template></value></part></template>
[[hint]] [[str]] [[finite]] (10/0);	<template><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>true + Error Zero Divisor</value></part></template>
[[hint]] [[str]] [[finite]] 10;		<template><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>true</value></part></template>
[[hint]] [[str]] [[finite]] 1000000000000000000000000000000000000000; <template><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>false</value></part></template></code>

<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>
